HOMEWOOD,BALTIMORE, MD., MARCH 1, 1929

MILITARY BALL TO BE
HELD TOMORROW
The Scabbard and Blade
will sponsor a Military Dance
tomorrow at 9:00 P. M: in the
C. E. Hall. The admission
price is one dollar stag or
couple. Music will be furnished by Bob Tula, in person,
and his orchestra.
Although the dance is being
sponsored by the Scabbard
and Blade and will be a Military Ball, all Hopkins men are
cordially invited to attend.

The Phi Beta Kappa Society will hold its annual meet- '
ing for the purpose of electing
members from the School of
Arts apd. Sciences, the Faculty
of Philosophy and the Medical
School shortly after Easter
this year. The average of the
first seven semesters in the
School of Arts and Sciences is
taken to decide upon those to
be. awarded. Only courses
which count towards graduation are considered.
